 subroutine bisect(a_keys, val, pos, idx, found)

! Performs a binary search on a_keys array, returns found and pos/idx.

   integer, intent(in) :: a_keys(:)

   integer, intent(in) :: val 

   integer, intent(out) :: pos, idx 

   logical, intent(out) :: found 

   integer :: low, high, mid, i 

   found = .false. pos = 1 

   low =1

   high = size(a_keys)

   if (high ==0) then 

     pos =1 ;idx=1 ; found =.false. return 

   end if 

   do 

     if (low > high) exit 

     mid = (low +high)/2 

     if (a_keys(mid) < val) then 

        low = mid+1 

     else if (a_keys(mid) > val) then 

        high =mid-1 

     else 

        found = .true. idx=mid 

        pos =mid 

        return 

     end if 

   end do 

   pos = low 

   idx=pos 

 end subroutine

Program main

 ng =0

 contains 

 subroutine set_program1()

  ! Reads the problem's input. 

  integer :: i 

  read(*,*)n 

  allocate(a(n))

  read(*,*) (a(i), i=1, n )

 end subroutine 

 logical function is_possible(k_val) 

  integer, intent(in) :: k_val 

  integer, allocatable :: keys(:), counts(:) 

  integer :: current 

  integer :: ai, p, pos, idx 

  integer :: sp, new_count, old, i 

  logical :: found 

  current =0 

  allocate(keys(0), counts(0))

  do i =1, n 

   ai = a(i) 

   if (ai <= current) then 

     ! need to process according to the logic. 

     ! Step 1: Remove all entries with keys >= ai. 

     ! This is done incrementally asking if the last key is GE to ai. 

     do 

        if (size(keys) ==0 ) exit 

        if (keys(size(keys)) < ai ) exit 

        call remove_last(keys, counts) 

     end do 

     p = ai -1 

     if (p <0) then 

        is_possible = .false. 

        return 

     end if 

     ! Now loop for updating p 

     do 

      ! enter process loop 

      ! find the value of p's current count 

      call bisect(keys, p, pos, idx, found)

      if (found) then 

         sp = counts(idx)

      else 

         sp =0 

      end if 

      sp = sp +1 

      if (sp ==k_val ) then 

          ! must increment p and loop again 

          if (found) then 

             call remove_entry(keys, counts, idx)

          end if 

          p = p -1 

          if (p <0) then 

              is_possible = .false. 

              return 

          end if 

      else 

        ! update the count 

        if (found) then 

          counts(idx) = sp 

          exit 

        else 

          call insert_entry(keys, counts, p, sp, pos )

          exit 

        end if 

      end if 

     end do 

    end if 

    current = ai 

  end do 

  is_possible = .true. 

  ! Deallocate keys and counts 

  deallocate(keys, counts) 

 end function 

 ! -- Subroutines to handle keys and counts 

 subroutine bisect(a_keys, val, pos, idx, found)

! Performs a binary search on a_keys array, returns found and pos/idx.

   integer, intent(in) :: a_keys(:)

   integer, intent(in) :: val 

   integer, intent(out) :: pos, idx 

   logical, intent(out) :: found 

   integer :: low, high, mid, i 

   found = .false.

   pos = 1 

   low =1

   high = size(a_keys)

   if (high ==0) then 

     pos =1 ;idx=1 ; found =.false. 

     return 

   end if 

   do 

     if (low > high) exit 

     mid = (low +high)/2 

     if (a_keys(mid) < val) then 

        low = mid+1 

     else if (a_keys(mid) > val) then 

        high =mid-1 

     else 

        found = .true. 

        idx=mid 

        pos =mid 

        return 

     end if 

   end do 

   pos = low 

   idx=pos 

 end subroutine 

 subroutine remove_entry(a_keys, a_counts, index )

   integer, intent(inout) :: a_keys(:), a_counts(:)

   integer, intent(in) :: index 

   integer :: pos 

   integer :: m 

   m = size(a_keys) 

   if (m==0 ) return 

   if (index <1 .or. index > m) return 

   integer :: new_m = m-1 

   if (new_m ==0 ) then 

      deallocate(a_keys, a_counts)

      allocate(a_keys(0), a_counts(0))

      return 

   end if 

   integer, allocatable :: t_keys(:),t_counts(:) 

   allocate(t_keys(new_m), t_counts(new_m))

    ! Copy elements except the one at index 

   pos =1 

   do i=1, m 

     if (i == index ) cycle 

     t_keys(pos) = a_keys(i) 

     t_counts(pos) = a_counts(i) 

     pos=pos+1 

   end do 

   deallocate(a_keys, a_counts)

   a_keys = t_keys 

   a_counts = t_counts 

 end subroutine 

 subroutine remove_last(a_keys, a_counts)

! removes last element (index m = size)

    integer, intent(inout) :: a_keys(:), a_counts(:)

    integer :: m 

    m = size(a_keys)

    if (m <=1 ) then 

      if (m ==0 ) then ! no elements 

         deallocate(a_keys, a_counts)

      else 

         deallocate(a_keys, a_counts) 

         allocate(a_keys(0), a_counts(0)) 

      end if 

      return 

    else 

      integer :: new_m = m -1 

      integer, allocatable :: t_keys(:), t_counts(:)

      allocate( t_keys(new_m), t_counts(new_m) )

      t_keys(:) = a_keys(1:new_m) 

      t_counts = a_counts(1:new_m )

      deallocate(a_keys, a_counts)

      a_keys = t_keys 

      a_counts = t_counts 

    end if 

 end subroutine 

 subroutine insert_entry(a_keys, a_counts, new_p, new_count, pos)

! inserts new_p at pos (0-based? )

   integer, intent(inout) :: a_keys(:), a_counts(:)

   integer, intent(in) :: new_p, new_count 

   integer, intent(in) :: pos 

   integer :: m, new_m 

   m = size(a_keys)

   new_m = m+1 

   ! Create new arrays 

   integer, allocatable :: temp_keys(:), temp_conuts(:)

   allocate(temp_keys(new_m), temp_conuts(new_m)) 

   temp_keys(1:pos-1) = a_keys(1: pos-1 )

   temp_keys(pos) = new_p 

   if (pos <=m ) then 

      temp_keys(pos+1 : new_m ) = a_keys(pos:m )

   else 

      ! pos is m+1 

      temp_keys(pos+1 : new_m ) = (/ /)

   end if 

   temp_conuts(1:pos-1) = a_counts(1: pos-1)

   temp_conuts(pos) = new_count
